snippet: A swing through Florida was no escape for Gov. Chris Christie as protesters hounded him, a State House ally rebuked his office and a mayor accused his administration of intimidation.
abstract: Hoboken, NJ, Mayor Dawn Zimmer says aides to Gov Chris Christie threatened to withhold money for Hurricane Sandy recovery for her hard-hit city if she did not support real estate development Christie wanted in her jurisdiction; disclosure adds to political woes surrounding Christie since George Washington Bridge scandal.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and KATE ZERNIKE
byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro reported from Florida and Kate Zernike from New Jersey. Nick Madigan contributed reporting from Palm Beach, Fla.

lead_paragraph: A swing through Florida was no escape for Gov. Chris Christie as protesters hounded him, a State House ally rebuked his office and a mayor accused his administration of intimidation.

headline.main: Mayor of Hoboken Says Hurricane Relief Was Threatened
headline.print_headline: Mayor Says State Officials Held Storm Aid Hostage
